author: Staff Reporter
text:
A day after he faced flak for refusing to answer a question on the sensational murder of a Dalit youth who had married a caste-Hindu girl, PMK founder S. Ramadoss on Tuesday said his party condemned the killing.

At a press conference here, Mr Ramadoss said, the PMK “strongly condemned” the murder of Dalit youth Shankar in Udumalpet and “all such barbaric acts of violence in the State.”

However, Mr. Ramadoss shied away from acknowledging the murder as “honour killing” and said it was indicative of the law and order situation in the State. “PMK is not opposed to inter-caste marriages. I have personally officiated over several such marriages,” he said.

Shocking, says Elangovan

Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president E.V.K.S. Elangovan said the murder in a public space has shocked everyone. He said in recent times, such crimes were taking place continuously.
title: Ramadoss too terms killing a barbaric act
